name: vs_mobile_old.png
title: Mobile front page — phone view, old
copy: An old version of the mobile front page, small/phone viewport size. Note the awkward spacing of visual blocks as well as the improper nesting of elements (div is an invalid child of a), which contributed to visual issues.

name: vs_mobile_new.png
title: Mobile front page — phone view, new
copy:
The mobile front page, phone/small view after my edits. I aligned the content blocks and fixed the HTML nesting.

Each content block in the Visit Seattle website is created using hand-coded Advanced Custom Fields blocks, which I added to and updated as needed. Between client requests, I overhauled these blocks, removing any errors, cleaning up the code, and removing removing any content blocks design confirmed they were not going to use.

name: vs_tablet_old.png
title: Mobile front page — tablet view, old
copy: An old version of the mobile front page, tablet/medium viewport size. Note the extra whitespace beneath the main image as well as the invalid HTML (div is an invalid child of a).

name: vs_tablet_new.png
title: Mobile front page — tablet view, new
copy: The mobile front page, tablet/small view after my edits. I aligned all visual blocks, altered the background images to be larger and more centered, and fixed the HTML nesting.

name: banner_current.png
title: GDPR Compliance — Subscription block, No Link
alt: A screenshot of the Visit Seattle website circa 2017, scrolled down to a newsletter subscription block.
copy:
An old version of the newsletter signup form. To prepare for GDPR compliance, I altered the website in a number of ways. In this case, I was tasked with altering the newsletter sign-up banner by adding a link to the Visit Seattle privacy policy and a checkbox affirming the user has read and agrees to that policy.

The sign-up form in its raw form comes from the Gravity Forms plugin for WordPress.

name: banner_nostyle.png
title: GDPR Compliance — Subscription block, with link, old style
alt: A screenshot of the Visit Seattle subscription block with an unstyled checkbpox and link.
copy: The subscription block, with the new link and checkbox, with the previous styling, which does not include the new elements. The original styling also makes the inputs quite small.

name: banner_styled.png
title: GDPR Compliance — Subscription block, with link and new style & cookie notification banner
alt: A screenshot of the Visit Seattle subscription banner with new styling, as well as a GDPR-compliant privacy policy notice and agreement.
copy:
The subscription block, with the new link and checkbox, styled. In addition to placing the link and checkbox, I took the opportunity to widen the subscription input fields to help with accessibility and visual balance.

This image also shows the sticky banner that informs the user of the site's cookie policy and requests consent, another GDPR compliance requirement. The banner is an implementation of the Cookie Consent Banner. At this point in development, the banner was using temporary copy.
